Natural Law.definition: a body of law or a specific principle of law that is held to be derived from nature and binding upon human society in the absence of or in addition to positive law NOTE

1.1: a body of law or a specific principle of law that is held to be derived from nature and binding upon human society in the absence of or in addition to positive law
1.note: While natural law, based on a notion of timeless order, does not receive as much credence as it did formerly, it was an important influence on the enumeration of natural rights by Thomas Jefferson and others.
